Boolean BindQuest(String pQuestname, [Alias ( of type guildobject) pSource])

Parameters:

    String pQuestname :
         quest to bind

    Alias ( of type guildobject) pSource : OPTIONAL 
         Questsource

Return Value:

    Boolean :
         true if succeeded, false if an error occurs

Description:

    binds the quest with the given questname

Nil BuildingGetBaseHP(Number iProto)

Parameters:

    Number iProto :
         building proto

Return Value:

    No return value

Description:

    gets the max hp of a building

Nil BuildingGetPriceProto(Number Proto)

Parameters:

    Number Proto :
         proto of the building

Return Value:

    No return value

Number Find(String TargetName, String FilterString, String ResultName, Number MaxResults)

Parameters:

    String TargetName :
         base amount of objects to bo searched by the filter

    String FilterString :
         the filter string

    String ResultName :
         alias of the result(s)

    Number MaxResults :
         max number of results.

Return Value:

    Number :
         number of found results

Description:

    checks a given amount of objects by the given filter string. The objects that passes the filter will be copied to the Result. Specifics depends on the filterstring and the used filters. If more than one object is found the resultname will be extended by an idx for ever found object (f.e. Result1, Result2...)

Number FindByID(String TargetName, Number FilterDBId, String ResultName, Number MaxResults)

Parameters:

    String TargetName :
         base amount of objects to bo searched by the filter

    Number FilterDBId :
         ID of the filter in the Database

    String ResultName :
         alias of the result(s)

    Number MaxResults :
         max number of results

Return Value:

    Number :
         number of found results

Description:

    checks a given amount of objects by the given filter via Filter DatabaseID. The objects that passes the filter will be copied to the Result. Specifics depends on the filterstring and the used filters. If more than one object is found the resultname will be extended by an idx for ever found object (f.e. Result1, Result2...)

Number FindByName(String TargetName, String FilterName, String ResultName, Number MaxResults)

Parameters:

    String TargetName :
         base amount of objects to bo searched by the filter

    String FilterName :
         name of the filter in the Database

    String ResultName :
         alias of the result(s)

    Number MaxResults :
         max number of results

Return Value:

    Number :
         number of found results

Description:

    checks a given amount of objects by the given filter via name int Database. The objects that passes the filter will be copied to the Result. Specifics depends on the filterstring and the used filters. If more than one object is found the resultname will be extended by an idx for ever found object (f.e. Result1, Result2...)

GetOutdoorLocator(String LocatorName, MaxCount, Alias ( of type position) ret_Position)

Parameters:

    String LocatorName :
         Name of the locator

     MaxCount :
         Max count of the locators that should be returned (-1 for all)

    Alias ( of type position) ret_Position :    OUTPUT
         The positions on success.

Return Value:

     :
         the number of found locators

Description:

    Get's outdoor-locator from the terrain by it's name. If there is more than one locator buy that name, the locator are returned with the name + the index number. eg. if ret_Position is "Pos", and 3 locators are found, the locators are returned as "Pos0", "Pos1", "Pos2". The first found locator is also returned as "Pos".

    String pQuestname :
         questname

    Alias ( of type guildobject) pQuestSourceAlias :

    No return value

Boolean PlaySound(String Sample, [Number Volume], [Number LoopCount], [String Channel])

Parameters:

    String Sample :
         The filename starting at "W:\TheGuild2\GameData\sfx" (i.e. "Effects/chest_open+0.wav")

    Number Volume : OPTIONAL 
         The volume from 0.0 to 1.0 (default 1.0)

    Number LoopCount : OPTIONAL 
         The loop-count (default 1). 0 means infinite loops

    String Channel : OPTIONAL 
         The channel (default "c3")

Return Value:

    Boolean :
         success

Description:

    Plays a global sound (regardless of the position of the camera)

Nil PlaySound(String Filename, [Number Volume = 1.0], [Number LoopCount = 1], [String Channel = ""])

Parameters:

    String Filename :
         The filename starting from "W:\TheGuild2\GameData\sfx".

    Number Volume :    DEFAULT VALUE : 1.0
         The volume of the sample from 0.0 - 1.0.

    Number LoopCount :    DEFAULT VALUE : 1
         The loop count of the sound.

    String Channel :    DEFAULT VALUE : ""
         The soundchannel where the sound should be played.

Return Value:

    No return value

Description:

    Plays a single sound which is heared regardless of the position of the camera.

Boolean PlaySoundVariation(String Foldername, [Number Volume], [Number LoopCount], [String Channel])

Parameters:

    String Foldername :
         The folder from where the sample will be choosen starting at "W:\TheGuild2\GameData\sfx" (i.e. "Effects/combat_cannon_strike_ground")

    Number Volume : OPTIONAL 
         The volume from 0.0 to 1.0 (default 1.0)

    Number LoopCount : OPTIONAL 
         The loop-count (default 1). 0 means infinite loops

    String Channel : OPTIONAL 
         The channel (default "c3")

Return Value:

    Boolean :
         success

Description:

    Plays a random global sound (regardless of the position of the camera)

Nil ResetQuest(String pQuestname, Alias ( of type guildobject) pQuestSourceAlias)

Parameters:

    String pQuestname :
         questname

    Alias ( of type guildobject) pQuestSourceAlias :
         Questsource Alias

Return Value:

    No return value

Description:

    resets the quest specified with pQuestname and QuestSource. If QuestSource is 0 all Quest with pQuestname will be reseted. If both are 0, the current quest will be reseted. Remember: though the quest will be reseted, the ingame impacts of the quest via runtime can not be reseted, so they have to be undone in the questscript.

Boolean ScenarioGetObjectByName(String ClassName, String ObjectName, String o_Object)

Parameters:

    String ClassName :
         class of the object (cl_Settlement, cl_Sim, cl_Cart, cl_Building, ...)

    String ObjectName :
         Name of the object

    String o_Object :    OUTPUT
         the found object

Return Value:

    Boolean :
         true: found / false: not found

Description:

    Get an object from the current world. To find the object the class and it's name is used

Number ScenarioGetObjects(String ClassName, Number MaxObjects, String o_Object)

Parameters:

    String ClassName :
         class of the object (cl_Settlement, cl_Sim, cl_Cart, cl_Building, ...)

    Number MaxObjects :
         Max count of objects to return

    String o_Object :    OUTPUT
         the found object's

Return Value:

    Number :
         number of found objects

Description:

    Get all objects from a class from the world. The Objects are returned in the aliases o_Object0 ... o_ObjectN). For example: ScenarioGetObjects("Settlement", 10, "City") gets all settlements and returns it in the aliasse "City0" ... "City9". The count of the aliasses are returned by this function. Attention: You should use this function carefully, because you can get all objects from a big class like "cl_Sim" and got a hole bunch of data.

String ShowTutorialBox(Number X, Number Y, Number Width, Number Height, Number ResolutionMode, Corner, PanelParam, HeaderText, BodyText, Picture, Variable Argument List )

Parameters:

    Number X :
         X position relativ to 1024

    Number Y :
         Y Position relativ to 768

    Number Width :
         Width, -1 for default width

    Number Height :
         Height, -1 for default height

    Number ResolutionMode :
         specifies if the panel should change its position at higher screen resolutions.

     Corner :
         specifies the corner and if a arrow will be displayed, valid values are:

     PanelParam :
         panel related parameters

     HeaderText :
         Header Text Label

     BodyText :
         Body Text Label

     Picture :
         optional Picture

    Variable Argument List :
         variable argument list. Will be shared for headerlabel, bodylabel and optional buttons

Return Value:

    String :
         the name of the last pressed button in the panel. If the panel will be closed elsewhere it will be "C"

Description:

    Shows a tutorial box specified by the given arguments, forces the script to wait for user input in the tutorial box, so be shure to add buttons on which the user can click or use ShowTutorialBoxNoWait

Boolean GetFreeLocatorByName(Alias ( of type building) pBuilding, String LocatorName, [Number StartNo], [Number EndNo], Alias ( of type position) o_Position, [Boolean SuppressErrorMessage = false]])

Parameters:

    Alias ( of type building) pBuilding :
         building to check

    String LocatorName :
         Name of the Locator without the Number

    Number StartNo : OPTIONAL 
         first number to check (-1=default)

    Number EndNo : OPTIONAL 
         last locator to check (-1=default)

    Alias ( of type position) o_Position :    OUTPUT
         free locator on success

    Boolean SuppressErrorMessage : OPTIONAL    DEFAULT VALUE : false]
         false: normal error logging true: suppress error logging

Return Value:

    Boolean :
         success

Description:

    this function looks for a free locator with the name LocatorName + Number. For example the call GetFreeLocatorByName("Work", "Entry", 1, 3) checks the locator "Entry1", "Entry2", "Entry3" of the building "work"

String MsgNews(Alias ( of type guildobject) pDestination, Alias ( of type corenode) pJumpToTarget, String pPanelParam, AIFunc, String pMessageClass, Number TimeOut, String pHeaderLabel, String pBodyLabel, Variable Argument List )

Parameters:

    Alias ( of type guildobject) pDestination :
         Object Alias to decide if the target is the player

    Alias ( of type corenode) pJumpToTarget :
         Jump to Target

    String pPanelParam :
         panel related parameters.

     AIFunc :
         lua function name for the AI reaction. If no AIFunc needed it has to be 0. If a false or not existing AIFunc is given this will result in an tolua error. Remember in lua you have to prefix with the whole scriptname. EG ms_walk_myfunction. The scriptname has to be lowercase

    String pMessageClass :
         the message class

    Number TimeOut :
         time out time for the news in gametime hours. time after which the news will be removed automaticaly. If no timeout should be attached use -1. If removed automaticaly the name of the last pressed button will be "C".

    String pHeaderLabel :
         textlabel, will be localized via the textsystem

    String pBodyLabel :
         textlabel, will be localized via the textsystem

    Variable Argument List :
         variable argument list for the localized text, will be share by HeaderLabel and BodyLabel

Return Value:

    String :
         the name of the last pressed button in the panel. If the panel will be closed elsewhere it will be "C"

Description:

    sends a news message for the given object and waits for the user to deal with it or for the given timeout

Boolean MsgNewsNoWait(Alias ( of type guildobject) pDestination, Alias ( of type corenode) pJumpToTarget, String pPanelParam, String pMessageClass, Number TimeOut, String pHeaderLabel, String pBodyLabel, Variable Argument List )

Number ThrowObject(Alias ( of type guildobject) pThrower, Alias ( of type guildobject) pTarget, sObjectModelName, Number a_fHeightRatio, Alias ( of type i_projectile) o_AliasName)

Parameters:

    Alias ( of type guildobject) pThrower :
         Target to throw at

    Alias ( of type guildobject) pTarget :
         Model of object to throw

     sObjectModelName :
         Model to Throw

    Number a_fHeightRatio :
         defines the steepness of the throwing parabel. 0.1 means 10% of throwing distance, 5.0 means 500% of throwing distance. was 0.5 hardcoded until now

    Alias ( of type i_projectile) o_AliasName :    OUTPUT
         returned ProjectileObject

Boolean StartMagicalEffect(Alias ( of type position) Position, Filename, Number Lifetime, Number Fadetime, Number StartRadius, Number EndRadius)

Parameters:

    Alias ( of type position) Position :
         The center of the effect (the height is not relevant -> It will be droped to the terrain height).

     Filename :
         The filename of the object which will be the effect (i.e. "particles/aimingpoint.nif").

    Number Lifetime :
         The lifetime of the effect in seconds.

    Number Fadetime :
         The duration of the fading-out (i.e. if the lifetime is 2.0 and the fadetime 0.8 then the fading-out will start after 1.2 seconds. It will always and at the end of the effect !)

    Number StartRadius :
         The size of the effect in units at the time the effect starts (regardless of the size of the .nif file)

    Number EndRadius :
         The size of the effect in units at the end of the effect.

Return Value:

    Boolean :
         True if the effect has started

Description:

    This function generates a "magical effect".

    String Path :

    Boolean :
